p: Furthermore, as biosynthesis and release of mating signals as well as the production of eggs may be influenced by atmospheric volatiles and gases [ 70, 71],. plant extracts, such as terpenes, can influence the site-choice of egg-laying female insects [ 70]. Although future experiments are required to isolate the effects of the exposure to essential oils on the physiological basis of oviposition and on the mating behavior, a potential energy trade-off between the detoxification process and oogenesis might be an explanation for the inhibited oviposition observed here [ 72â€“ 74].
